service:
You can use the Cost Optimization Hub API to programmatically identify, filter, aggregate, and quantify savings for your cost optimization recommendations across multiple Amazon Web Services Regions and Amazon Web Services accounts in your organization.

The Cost Optimization Hub API provides the following endpoint:

  • https://cost-optimization-hub.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

operations.GetPreferences: Returns a set of preferences for an account in order to add account-specific preferences into the service. These preferences impact how the savings associated with recommendations are presentedâ€”estimated savings after discounts or estimated savings before discounts, for example.
operations.GetRecommendation:
Returns both the current and recommended resource configuration and the estimated cost impact for a recommendation.

The recommendationId is only valid for up to a maximum of 24 hours as recommendations are refreshed daily. To retrieve the recommendationId, use the ListRecommendations API.
operations.ListEnrollmentStatuses: Retrieves the enrollment status for an account. It can also return the list of accounts that are enrolled under the organization.
operations.ListRecommendationSummaries:
Returns a concise representation of savings estimates for resources. Also returns de-duped savings across different types of recommendations.

The following filters are not supported for this API: recommendationIds, resourceArns, and resourceIds.
operations.UpdateEnrollmentStatus:
Updates the enrollment (opt in and opt out) status of an account to the Cost Optimization Hub service.

If the account is a management account of an organization, this action can also be used to enroll member accounts of the organization.

You must have the appropriate permissions to opt in to Cost Optimization Hub and to view its recommendations. When you opt in, Cost Optimization Hub automatically creates a service-linked role in your account to access its data.
operations.UpdatePreferences: Updates a set of preferences for an account in order to add account-specific preferences into the service. These preferences impact how the savings associated with recommendations are presented.

AccessDeniedException.base: You are not authorized to use this operation with the given parameters.

AccountEnrollmentStatus.base: Describes the enrollment status of an organization's member accounts in Cost Optimization Hub.

refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesResponse$items: The enrollment status of a specific account ID, including creation and last updated timestamps.

refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesRequest$accountId: The account ID of a member account in the organization.

refs.Filter$accountIds: The account that the recommendation is for.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$actionType: The type of action you can take by adopting the recommendation.

refs.Filter$actionTypes: The type of action you can take by adopting the recommendation.

BlockStoragePerformanceConfiguration.base: Describes the Amazon Elastic Block Store performance configuration of the current and recommended resource configuration for a recommendation.

refs.EbsVolumeConfiguration$performance: The Amazon Elastic Block Store performance configuration.

refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$sizeFl: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.ElastiCacheReservedInstancesConfiguratio: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.Filter$restartNeeded: Whether or not implementing the recommendation requires a restart.
refs.Filter$rollbackPossible: Whether or not implementing the recommendation can be rolled back.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$restartNeeded: Whether or not implementing the recommendation requires a restart.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$rollbackPossib: Whether or not implementing the recommendation can be rolled back.
refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesResponse$includeMe: The enrollment status of all member accounts in the organization if the account is the management account.
refs.OpenSearchReservedInstancesConfiguration: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.RdsReservedInstancesConfiguration$sizeFl: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.Recommendation$restartNeeded: Whether or not implementing the recommendation requires a restart.
refs.Recommendation$rollbackPossible: Whether or not implementing the recommendation can be rolled back.
refs.RedshiftReservedInstancesConfiguration$s: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.UpdateEnrollmentStatusRequest$includeMem: Indicates whether to enroll member accounts of the organization if the account is the management account.

ComputeConfiguration.base: Describes the performance configuration for compute services such as Amazon EC2, Lambda, and ECS.

ComputeSavingsPlansConfiguration.base: The Compute Savings Plans configuration used for recommendations.

refs.ComputeSavingsPlans$configuration: Configuration details of the Compute Savings Plans to purchase.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$lastRefreshTim: The time when the recommendation was last generated.
refs.Recommendation$lastRefreshTimestamp: The time when the recommendation was last generated.

refs.BlockStoragePerformanceConfiguration$iop: The number of I/O operations per second.
refs.ComputeConfiguration$vCpu: The number of vCPU cores in the resource.
refs.EstimatedDiscounts$otherDiscount: Estimated other discounts include all discounts that are not itemized. Itemized discounts include reservedInstanceDiscount and savingsPlansDiscount.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$estimatedMonth: The estimated monthly cost of the recommendation.
The estimated monthly savings amount for the recommendation.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$estimatedSavin: The estimated savings amount over the lookback period used to calculate cost impact for a recommendation.
The estimated savings percentage relative to the total cost over the cost calculation lookback period.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesResponse$esti: The total overall savings for the aggregated view.
refs.Recommendation$estimatedMonthlyCost: The estimated monthly cost for the recommendation.
refs.Recommendation$estimatedMonthlySavings: The estimated monthly savings amount for the recommendation.
refs.Recommendation$estimatedSavingsPercentag: The estimated savings percentage relative to the total cost over the cost calculation lookback period.
refs.RecommendationSummary$estimatedMonthlySa: The estimated total savings resulting from modifications, on a monthly basis.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$estimatedMonthl: The estimated cost of your recurring monthly fees for the recommended reserved instance across the month.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$estimatedOnDema: The remaining On-Demand cost estimated to not be covered by the recommended reserved instance, over the length of the lookback period.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$monthlyReservat: The cost of paying for the recommended reserved instance monthly.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$savingsPercenta: The savings percentage relative to the total On-Demand costs that are associated with this instance.
refs.ResourcePricing$estimatedCostAfterDiscou: The savings estimate incorporating all discounts with Amazon Web Services, such as Reserved Instances and Savings Plans.
refs.ResourcePricing$estimatedCostBeforeDisco: The savings estimate using Amazon Web Services public pricing without incorporating any discounts.
refs.ResourcePricing$estimatedNetUnusedAmorti: The estimated net unused amortized commitment for the recommendation.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$estimatedMonthlyComm: Estimated monthly commitment for the Savings Plan.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$estimatedOnDemandCos: Estimated On-Demand cost you will pay after buying the Savings Plan.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$monthlySavingsPlansE: The cost of paying for the recommended Savings Plan monthly.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$savingsPercentage: Estimated savings as a percentage of your overall costs after buying the Savings Plan.
